venue.name: Hunnewell Visitor Center at the Arnold Arboretum

item.description:
Come to a Roundtable Discussion on the Olmsteds and their historic home, a forum entitled "The Olmsteds: Brookline, Boston, and Beyond," Sunday, September 7th, from 1 to 3 PM.

At the conclusion of a two day visit to "Fairsted," the Olmsteds' home and office, four scholars will reflect on their visit, and share their perspectives on the significance of Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site and its continuing value to a 21st century public.

Scholars speaking will be:
-Charles Beveridge, Historian and Series Editor of the Olmsted Papers Project
-Ethan Carr, Landscape Historian -University of Virginia, Charlottesville
-Alexander Garvin, Architect & Planner - Yale University
-Dolores Hayden, Urban Historian & Architect - Yale University

Sponsored by the National Park Service in cooperation with the Organization of American Historians.
item.name: Roundtable Discussion on the Olmsteds: Brookline, Boston, and Beyond
